TopicTitle: How do you feel about using parts-clipping?

Articles.Content:
Every time I'm building an SSTO and it comes to the landing legs I'm always tempted to do this.  But I always tend to avoid it because it feels sort of... wrong.   It's part of the stock game, it's not an add-on or a mod that I'm using to change the game.  So it's technically fair.  I see it a bit like using time-acceleration to freeze a rotating ship.  It's a feature in the game, but... at the same time it feels like abusing things to make the game easier.

EDIT:
Sorry if people are sick to death of this question coming up, but I wasn't able to find an actual polled question regarding this, and I wanted to see how it was broken-down among the community.

I will do an honest reply so you feel better about asking.  I use it when it makes sense.  I will not do it when I have things like engines, fuel containers, or something with what would have a bunch of electronics (like a command pod) because then you are cutting off some of the abilities of that craft due to lack of space.  I will use it with things like landing legs and structure parts because then you are just manipulating the superstructure of the craft without effecting the volume of the consumables or something like that.
